questions.text: Epiphysis involved in which bone tumor:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Option A-Osteosarcoma is a metaphyseal tumour. Option B-Multiple myeloma is a tumour of bone marrow. Option C-Giant cell tumor arises from epiphysis as shown in picture below. Option D-Ewings sarcoma is a diaphyseal tumour.

questions.text: GCT is:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) For GCT,better answer is Epiphyseometaphyseal > epiphyseal.

questions.text: Most common tumor of hand:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Option A-when question is asked about M/C tumour of hand bone, then answer becomes enchondroma. Option B-Squamous cell carcinoma is the M/C tumour of hand. Option C-chondroblastoma commonly arises from epiphysis of long bones like femur and tibia. Option D-Melanoma is a skin tumour which most commonly occurs on the back.

choices.text: Secondaries of spine – Winking owl sign

questions.text: Which of the following is wrongly matched?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Option A-Osteosarcoma has Sunray appearance. Option B-Soap bubble appearance is seen in GCT not Chondroblastoma as shown in picture below. Option C-Ewing’s sarcoma has Onion peel appearance. Option D-Secondaries of spine shows Winking owl sign.

questions.text: All of the following tumor are benign tumor except:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Option A-Chondroma , as the name suggests is a benign tumour of cartilage. Option B-Chordoma is a low grade malignant tumour of notochordal remnant. Option C-Osteochondroma is the most common benign bone tumour. Option D-Enchondroma is a benign tumour of small bones like hand.

questions.text: All are true about aneurysmal bone cyst except:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Option A- aneurysmal bone cyst is Eccentric in location. Option B-it`s an Expansile and lytic lesion. Option C-Treatment of aneurysmal bone cyst is extended curettage and bone grafting, not simple curettage. Option D-occurs in Metaphysis of long bones.

questions.text: Fallen fragment sign is a feature of:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Option A-Its a feature of SBC not ABC, as there is no septation in SBC, when cortex breaks off, it falls off in cavity giving the X ray appearance of fallen fragment sign as shown in picture. Option B-Aneurysmal bone cyst mimcs appearance of GCT. Option C-Giant cell tumour shows soap bubble appearance. Option D-Fibrous dysplasia shows shepherd crook`s deformity on X ray.

choices.text: Commonly presents in the 20-40 years age group
Matrix consists of proliferating mononuclear cells
Osteoclast giant cells constitute the proliferative component of the tumour
It is a benign tumor which may have lung metastasis.

questions.text: About Giant cell tumor, all are true except:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Option A-It is seen in 20-40 years age group Option B-Matrix consists of proliferating mononuclear cells which are mainly osteoblastic precursors. Option C-Osteoclast giant cells do not constitute the proliferative component of the tumour because Matrix consists of proliferating mononuclear cells which are mainly osteoblastic precursors. Option D-benign but locally aggressive with uncertain origin (Monocyte macrophage lineage). Although benign, rarely it can have lung metastasis.

questions.text: In GCT, malignant component is:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) GCT is a benign tumour, but locally aggressive with uncertain origin (Monocyte macrophage lineage).Matrix consists of proliferating mononuclear cells which are mainly osteoblastic precursors.Osteoclast giant cells do not constitute the proliferative component of the tumour because Matrix consists of proliferating mononuclear cells which are mainly osteoblastic precursors.

questions.text: Which of the following is a variant of giant cell tumour:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Non Ossifying fibroma is a relatively better answer here , as GCT has no matrix calcification, while all other options presents with matrix calcification like Ossifying fibroma,Osteogenic sarcoma and Chondroblastoma. Giant cell variants can be remembered by a mnemonic of FAN OUCH:- Fibrous dysplasia ABC Non ossifying fibroma Osteitis fibrosa cystica Unicameral bone cyst Chondromyxoid fibroma Hyper PTH

questions.text: Most common benign tumor of the bone is:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Option A-Giant cell tumor is a benign but locally aggressive tumour. Option B-Simple bone cyst is a cystic lesion in bone with fallen fragment sign. Option C-M/C primary benign bone tumour- osteochondroma/exostosis (but it`s not a true benign tumour).M/C TRUE primary benign bone tumour – Osteoid osteoma Option D-Enchondroma is the M/C bone tumour of hand.

questions.text: Factors indicating malignant degeneration in Osteochondroma
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) Out of these options,>2cm thickness of cartilage is significant of malignant degeneration in osteochondroma.Hence biopsy is recommended to rule out malignancy.

questions.text: Maffucci syndrome:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Maffucci’s syndrome is characterized by Multiple enchondroma, subcutaneous haemangioma and phleboliths.

questions.text: Most common tumor in bones of hand:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Option A-Exostosis is the M/C benign bone tumour.it usually arises from metaphysis of long bones. Option B-Giant cell tumor arises from epiphysis of long bones. Option C-Squamous cell carcinoma is the M/C tumour of hand, but when question is asked about M/C tumour of hand bone, then answer becomes enchondroma. Option D-Synovial sarcoma is a malignancy arising from synovial lining of joints.

questions.text: Identify the lesion in the X-ray:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Option A-In picture,an Epiphyseal lytic lesion is present ,before fusion of epiphysis is s/o Chondroblastoma. Option B-Osteoclastoma/GCT is also epiphyseal , but that occurs after closure of physis. . Option C-ABC mimics GCT but arises in metaphyseal region. Option D-Eosinophilic granuloma presents with a geographic lytic lesion in skull.

questions.text: X-ray proximal femur in a patient with hip pain. The deformity shown is:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Option A-Blade of grass deformity seen in paget`s disease. Option B-Xray is s/o Shepherd crook deformity which is seen in fibrous dysplasia. Option C-Chicken wire appearance is a biopsy appearance seen in chondroblastoma Option D-Corduroy appearance is seen in spine in hemangioma.

questions.text: A patient presents with pain in the thigh, relieved by aspirin. X- ray shows a radiolucent mass surrounded by sclerosis. Diagnosis is:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Option A-Osteoma can occur in the sinuses of skull as a small bony protrusion. Option B-Clinical picture of night pain relieved with aspirin(that means pain is due to prostaglandins), and X ray sign of radiolucent mass surrounded by sclerosis is diagnostic of osteoid osteoma. Option C-Osteoblastoma also presents with night pain but it is less commonly relieved by aspirin. Option D-Osteoclastoma has a soap bubble appearance.

questions.text: The following reaction is associated with which tumor?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Option A-Metaphyseal tumour with sunray appearance is diagnostic of osteosarcoma. Option B-chondroblastoma/Codman`s tumour has popcorn calcification in the matrix. Option C-Ewings sarcoma is diaphyseal tumour with onion peel appearance. Option D-chondroblastoma/Codman`s tumour has popcorn calcification in the matrix.

questions.text: In osteogenic sarcoma predominant histological finding is:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Option A-Giant cells are seen in GCT. Option B-In osteogenic sarcoma tumour can be – osteoblastic, Osteolytic or Chondroblastic as the tumour cells are pleuripotent. But the predominant among these is ,the Osteoid forming tumor cells. Option C-Fibroblastic proliferation can be a component of osteogenic sarcoma but the predominant component is ,the Osteoid forming tumor cells. Option D-Chondroblasts can be a component of osteogenic sarcoma but the predominant component is ,the Osteoid forming tumor cells.

choices.text: Osteosarcoma of lower limbs and soft tissue sarcoma

questions.text: Children with germline retinoblastoma are more likely to develop other primary malignancies in their later lifetime course. Which of the following can occur in such patients?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Option A-Patients of retinoblastoma have high risk of developing osteosarcoma in later life as Rb gene is mutated in both of these conditions. Option B,C,D-Rb gene is not mutated in Thyroid carcinoma,Seminoma and Squamous cell carcinoma.

questions.text: Radiation induced tumor:
questions.solution: Correct information (A) Osteosarcoma is the M/C radiation induced tumour and occur at unusual sites like skull,clavicle, spine, ribs,etc. It results 10-15 years after radiation exposure

questions.text: All of the following investigations are needed for the diagnosis of Osteosarcoma except:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Option A-MRI of femur is done to know the local invasion of tumour. Option B-Biopsy always remains the gold standard investigation for neoplasic lesions,but in osteosarcoma biopsy is taken from the leading edge of the lesion, not from bone marrow. Option C-Bone scan can be done to look for bony metastasis. Option D-CT chest is done to look for lung metastasis.

questions.text: A 7-year-old boy presents with swelling and pain over tibia. On X-ray there is periosteal reaction in diaphysis. Probable diagnosis is:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Option A-Both osteomyelitis and Ewings seems to be answer here but osteomyelitis starts in metaphysis and very rarely/lately involve diaphysis, while Ewings sarcoma`s site of origin is diaphysis. Option B-Chondroblastoma arises from epiphysis. Option C-Ewings sarcoma`s site of origin is diaphysis. Option D-Osteosarcoma arises from metaphysis.

questions.text: In 1st decade ,most common bone tumour:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Option A- Ewings sarcoma occurs in 5-15years age group. Option B-Osteosarcoma is bimodal :10-20 years and 40-60 years Option C-Multiple myeloma- >50 years

questions.text: A 15-year-old boy is injured while playing cricket. X rays of the leg rule out a possible fracture. The radiologist reports the boy has an evidence of aggressive bone tumor with both bone destruction and soft tissue mass. The bone biopsy reveals a bone cancer with neural differentiation. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Option A-Chondroblastoma shows a chondroid differentiation with popcorn calcification. Option B-Ewing’s sarcoma is an example of Peripheral neuroectodermal tumors (PNET) that share a common translocation t(11:22) and round cells, differing only in their degree of neural differentiation.Ewing’s sarcoma is poorly differentiated whereas PNET exhibits definite neural differentiation. Option C-Neuroblastoma is more commonly seen in 1st decade. Option D-Osteosarcoma shows osteoid differentiation.

questions.text: A 7-year-old boy with H/o trauma 2 months back now presents with fever and acute pain over thigh. On X-ray, femoral shaft shows lesions with multiple laminated periosteal reaction.next line of management is:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) Option A-CRP measurement is neither sensitive nor specific for ewing sarcoma. Option B-Biopsy remains the gold standard, but before biopsy all non-invasive investigation should be done. Option C-Tc99 MDP scan can be done tolook for bony metastasis. Option D-Diagnosis here is “Ewing’s sarcoma” (fever,pain and onion peel appearance) and next best investigation is MRI.

questions.text: A patient with pain in back. Lab investigation shows elevated ESR. X-ray skull shows multiple punched out lytic lesions. Most important Investigation to be done is
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) pain in back, elevated ESR and multiple punched out lytic lesions suggests Clinical diagnosis of multiple myeloma and Serum electrophoresis is the best investigation for the same.

questions.text: Most common malignancy that metastasizes to the spine is
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Most common malignancy that metastasizes to the spine is:- Male- prostate>lung Female- Breast>lung Overall M/C – Breast>prostate>lung.

choices.text: Proximal parts of long bones of the upper limb

questions.text: Metastasis are least common in
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) Proximal parts of femur / humerus are the M/C sites of long bone metastasis. Metastasis distal to knee & elbow ,i.e acral metastasis is rare and M/C being is tibia and M/C is due to lung tumour. Hand metastasis is the most rare.

questions.text: A 60-year-old male has bone pain, vertebral collapse and pathological fracture in pelvis. The most probable diagnosis is
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) It could be metastasis, more likely than multiple myeloma, considering the site, the age and the incidence,all are pointing towards metastasis as a diagnosis.

questions.text: A 4 year old child complains of pain and swelling of left tibia. On evaluation patient has high ESR, leucocytosis and x ray depicts tibial lesion. best investigation is ?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) Option A-Blood C/S can be done as one of the investigation in osteomyelitis but it`s not the best investigation. Option B-MRI is a good radiological tool however it`s not the best investigation. Option C-Pus C/S is one of the investigation in osteomyelitis but it`s not the best investigation. Option D-based on clinical history D/D are : Ewings sarcoma and osteomyelitis, which is BEST diagnosed by biopsy.

questions.text: The given image is an xray of a 22-year-old female. What is the probable diagnosis?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Option A-Chondroblastoma occurs in males of less than 18 years age. Option B-Osteochondroma presents as a bony stalk covered by a cartilaginous cap. Option C-The given X ray showing a lytic lesion at the end of a long bone with a soap bubble appearance suggests a giant cell tumor (GCT) or osteoclastoma. A GCT is a benign but locally aggressive tumor commonly occurring at the ends of long bones as a solitary lytic lesion in epiphysis. Option D-Aneurysmal bone cyst mimic GCT but occurs in a younger age group.

questions.text: Treatment of choice for symptomatic Osteochondroma is?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Extraberiosteal Excision Explanations 1. Since patient is Symbtomatic, observation only cannot be the answer. 2. Simple Excision without periosteum can lause recurrence. 3. Extraperiosteal Excision is treatment of choice as chances of recurrence will be less 4. Curettage is not done for Osteochondvoma.

choices.text: Chicken wire calcification and Giant cells.

questions.text: Which of the following is true for chandroblastoma?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) All of the above Explanations. 1. Chondroblastoma arises from Epibhysis and it is Eccentric in location and slightly expansile 2. On biopsy, chicken wire calcification and Giant cells are seen 3. Treatment is Curettage with Bone grafting 4. All of above are correct:

questions.text: Most common premalignant lesion for osteosarcoma is ?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Paget's disease Explanation Paget's disease is the Most common pre-Malignant lesion for Osteosarcoma. There is 1% conversion into osteosarcoma.

questions.text: Bone to Bone Metastasic is Most commonly seen ins.
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Ewings Explanations 1 and 2 = Osteosarcoma and Ewing both Can Cause Bony Metastasis but better answer is Ewing sarcoma 3 and 4) – Osteoma and Osteoid Osteoma are Benign lesions and do not cause Metastasis.

questions.text: Which of the following is true about spina ventosa?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) All of above Explanations. 1. Spina ventosa is another name for tubercular Dactylitis in which Metacarpals are usually involved. 2. Usually, Periosteal reaction is not seen in TB of bones at other sites, But here, periosteal reaction is present 3. DID is Enchondroma and hence Biopsy is Mandatory 4. All of above are true

questions.text: A child present to OPD with features S/O Ewing sarcoma. Which of the following IHC Markers will be positive in this patient?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (E) All of above Explanation Ewing Sarcoma is positive for CD99, CDS7, NSE, S-100 and also MIC-2

questions.text: Most chemo and Radiosensitive Bone tumour is ?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Explanation 1. Osteosarcoma is the Most Radio resistant Bone tumour. 2. Ewing Sarcoma is the Mast chemo and radiosensitive bone tumour 3-4. Osteoma and Osteoid Osteoma are Benign tumours, treated by Excision

questions.text: Which of the following, is not a component of Mirel score?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) Mirel score is used to calculate possibility of impending Pathological fracture in bony secondaries Mirel’s score includes the followings. a. Size of lesion b. site of lesion c. Nature of lesion d. Pain due to lesion If total Score> 8, It Indicates a high risk of pathological fracture
